text:
The Mail task allows the user to specify multiple comma-separated files as 
arguments.  The contents of these files are inserted into the body of the 
message.  However, the task does not include the name of the file before 
including its contents into the body.  Understanding the contents of the mail 
becomes very difficult in this case as one cannot easily distinguish the origin 
and end of each file.
Inserting the file name before inserting the file's contents would help me 
better distinguish and understand the contents.

Cheers,
Magesh
creator: umagesh@rediffmail.com

text:
Created attachment 388
Includes Name of file before including contents of file into message body.
creator: umagesh@rediffmail.com
steve_l@iseran.com
text:
There is a task in the up and coming ant1.4 beta, MimeMail, which adds files as 
separate mime attachments. Would that meet your requirements, or is there a 
specific need for the files to come as delimited text files?

If MimeMail would work for you, you can get it now by fetching the current 
source of CVS and building it -making sure you have a couple of libraries 
(activation and javax.mail) first, as covered in the task documentation.

creator: umagesh@rediffmail.com
text:
Is the Mail task going to be deprecated in 1.4 then?  If it is not going to be, 
then, I think, adding the patch I have submitted would improve the existing 
task a little bit.  If it is going to be deprecated, then this isn't an issue 
(for me, at least).

Cheers,
Magesh

creator: tim@adjective.org
text:
The patch you have supplied always includes the name of the file.
That is a not insignificant change in behaviour, and you have not made it 
configurable.
I'm sure there are people using this task that rely on there not being filename 
in the email.

eg People could be using the filenames as "templates" for their emails - 
perhaps attaching a confidenciality notice, I doubt they want to 
see "disclaimer.txt=" in the mail

I don't see how it matters whether mail is to be deprecated.
It will just mean that if you want to attach files then MimeMail is the 
recommended task.

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
The mail task will NOT be deprecated. It is there as a bare bones service for 
situations where users do not have the javamail and activation stuff available. 
Also, the likelihood of functionality changes being included in Ant 1.4 is now 
getting remote. We can look at this change once 1.4 is out the door, of course.

creator: umagesh@rediffmail.com
text:
Created attachment 398
[PATCH] Inclusion of filenames is now configurable.

creator: umagesh@rediffmail.com
text:
Following up on Tim's comment, I have submitted a patch that makes inclusion of 
file names configurable.  This patch is backwards compatible - it doesn't 
change in any way the existing functionality unless an extra attribute 
(includefilenames) is set to true.  If it can get into 1.4, well and good.  If 
it doesn't, I hope it will find the light of day, at least in a future 
release.  

I haven't mentioned anything about mime 'attachments' in this bug report (That 
I did in a different thread :-) and yes, MimeMail will be useful for sending 
attachments).

Cheers,
Magesh
You're now in the position to either apply the patch or close the bug yourself 8-)
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text: Patch applied.  Filenames of attachments can be included optionally by the user.
